elements.label: Attendee
elements.description: People who are verified attendees of an event

elements.label: Member
elements.description: People who are verified members of a group or event

elements.label: Section
elements.description: Distinct parts of a document or website

elements.label: Item
elements.description: Anything you create on Catalist - a post, resource, offer, or event - is an object categorized with a type.

elements.label: Event
elements.description: Something happening with a start and end date

elements.label: Organization
elements.description: An established entity such as a university or company

elements.label: Location
elements.description: Locations are countries, cities or other areas of geographical space.

elements.label: Vincent Arena

elements.summary: The Wealth Hackers Initiative (WHI) is an emerging network of individuals and organisations who are disrupting traditional wealth management practices to accelerate the flow of resources towards a more equitable and resilient future.
elements.label: Wealth Hackers Initiative

elements.summary: Founded in 2003, Post Carbon Institute’s mission is to lead the transition to a more resilient, equitable, and sustainable world by providing individuals and communities with the resources needed to understand and respond to the interrelated ecological, economic, energy, and equity crises of the 21st century
elements.label: Post Carbon Institute

elements.summary: Our mission is to catalyse an economy in service of life by ⁠curating spaces to reconnect to self, community and the living world, ⁠reimagine the future, and ⁠incubate bold collective action.
elements.label: Ostara Collective

elements.summary: People Powered is a global hub for participatory democracy - the direct participation of community members in making the policy decisions that affect their lives.
elements.label: People Powered

elements.summary:
Another world is happening.
We’re a coalition of 200+ organizations building the solidarity economy in the U.S. and showing that another world is not only possible — it’s already happening.
elements.label: New Economy Coalition

elements.summary:
Omidyar Network is a philanthropic organization whose mission is to bend the arc of the digital revolution toward shared power, prosperity, and possibility.

We invest in and collaborate with some of the world’s brightest visionaries and ventures to guide our digital future toward the greatest good for the greatest number of people.
elements.label: Omidyar Network

elements.summary:
A better future with technology is possible.
Center for Humane Technology is a nonprofit dedicated to ensuring that today's most consequential technologies, such as AI and social media, actually serve humanity. We bring clarity to how the tech ecosystem works in order to shift the incentives that drive it.
elements.label: Center for Humane Technology

elements.summary:
More than 8 million species share our planet. We only understand the language of one.
Earth Species Project is the new frontier of interspecies understanding. We decode animal communication with advanced AI to illuminate the diverse intelligences on earth.

Our vision is a relationship with the rest of nature that allows the diversity of life to thrive.
elements.label: Earth Species Project

elements.summary:
The Civilization Research Institute works to support the emergence of a mature global civilization //
capable of wisely stewarding the unprecedented power of exponential technologies //
in concert with an enduringly healthy biosphere //
while avoiding the twin failure modes of catastrophes and dystopias.
elements.label: Civilization Research Institute

elements.summary: The Psychedelic Science Funders Collaborative is a community of philanthropists dedicated to enabling access to psychedelic healing for all who can benefit.
elements.label: Psychedelic Science Funders Collaborative

elements.summary: MAPS is a nonprofit organization that provides public resources and leadership as we work together to create legalresponsibleevidence–based pathways to psychedelics.
elements.label: MAPS

elements.summary:
Bioregional
Finance
for Planetary
Regeneration
We are a collective supporting bioregions to design, create, capitalize, implement, and evolve Bioregional Financing Facilities that connect financial resources and regenerators.
elements.label: Biofi Project

elements.summary: Holos is a global field of regeneration—for individuals, cultures, and ecosystems
elements.label: Holos Global

elements.summary:
AI research and products that put safety at the frontier
AI will have a vast impact on the world. Anthropic is a public benefit corporation dedicated to securing its benefits and mitigating its risks.
elements.label: Anthropic

elements.summary: Momentum is a training institute and community of movement organizers.
elements.label: Momentum School

elements.summary: Our mission is to offer tea, teaware, education and community spaces to support and deepen your tea journey, while honoring the history, craftspeople, farmers and environments that are essential to tea. Our focus on the relationship between Zen, Daoist philosophy and tea aims to aid you in your self-cultivation, toward personal and collective awakening.
elements.label: Global Tea Hut

elements.summary: Plum Village, near Bordeaux in southwest France, is the largest international practice center in the Plum Village tradition, and the first monastic community founded by Zen Master Thich Nhat Hanh (Thay) in the West.
elements.label: Plum Village Community

elements.summary:
We are a non-profit committed to deepening our relationship with land. 

Drawing on the experiences of working in conventional real estate, land justice, and living and working in community, the Center for Ethical Land Transition explores ways to decommodify, rematriate, and increase accessibility to land for Indigenous, Black, and POC communities
elements.label: Center for Ethical Land Transition

elements.summary: At The Society Library, we recognize that a person’s relationship to information is one of the most fundamental, most important, and most powerful. We rely on information (whether that information is internal thoughts, instincts, and feelings - or external data, claims, and conversation) to make meaning of the world and make choices. Access to information can enable more enlightened, empowered, and emancipated decisions, just as deprivation of information can confine, control, and coerce our choices.
elements.label: The Society Library

elements.summary: Gesturing Towards Decolonial Futures (GTDF) is an arts/research collective that uses this website as a workspace for collaborations around different kinds of artistic, pedagogical, cartographic, and relational experiments that aim to identify and de-activate colonial habits of being, and to gesture towards the possibility of decolonial futures.
elements.label: Gesturing Towards Decolonial Futures

elements.summary:
Collective Funding for Regenerating Earth
Ma Earth shares ideas and builds tools for planetary health and regeneration—combining education with grants funding to resource those directly caring for land and life.
elements.label: Ma Earth

elements.summary: Naia is an animist trust dedicated to creating the conditions on Earth for all beings to thrive.
elements.label: Naia Trust

elements.summary:
Hypercerts Represent the Impact of Work
Every hypercert accounts for a discrete piece of work and represents the impact resulting from that work. Projects create hypercerts for their work. Evaluators assess the outputs, outcomes and impact of projects' work. Funders buy hypercert fractions and receive the rights to claim the represented impact.
elements.label: HyperCerts

elements.summary: We cultivate tools, practices, and communities that enable self-governance in the digital age.
elements.label: Metagov

elements.summary:
Earth Force trains adults to infuse civic experiences into environmental education to create environmental citizens.

Wherever you’re at, we can help.

We work with adults of all kinds – from K-12 educators, to afterschool educators, to municipal agencies, to environmental education organizations – as well as the adults who provide them training.

For many, bringing real civic action into their interactions with young people represents a pretty big shift in thinking.

Our expertise is in easing that transition in a powerful and sustainable way.
elements.label: Earth Force

elements.summary: Climate Designers provides the knowledge, skills, and professional network to support designers in becoming climate leaders everywhere they work
elements.label: Climate Designers

elements.summary:
Wellbeing Economy Alliance (WEAll) is the collaboration of changemakers working together to transform
the economic system

thousands
elements.label: Well-Being Economy Alliance

elements.summary: The Earth Charter is a document with sixteen principles that drive a global movement towards a more just, sustainable and peaceful world. To support the movement, our Education Center offers courses, resource materials and network opportunities to turn conscience into action.
elements.label: Earth Charter

elements.summary:
Steering transformative technology towards benefiting life and away from extreme large-scale risks.
We believe that the way powerful technology is developed and used will be the most important factor in determining the prospects for the future of life. This is why we have made it our mission to ensure that technology continues to improve those prospects.
elements.label: Future of Life Institute

elements.summary: The Collaborative Technology Alliance exists to facilitate collaboration, coordination, and community among platform designers, developers, and stewards who are committed to building social technology that benefits both people and planet.
elements.label: Collaborative Technology Alliance

elements.summary:
Together, We are Healing Ourselves and the Earth.
With roots in the Amazon rainforest, we equip people around the world with inspiration and training to regenerate the planet’s ecosystems, bring justice to their communities, and restore our relationships with the Earth, each other, and ourselves.
elements.label: Pachamama Alliance

elements.summary:
Sustaining Places
Across Generations
Honoring the spirit of place, stewarding land and buildings and providing opportunities for those inspired to work in harmony with land and nature.
elements.label: Living Land Trust

elements.summary:
Steering transformative AI towards better outcomes. 
For everyone.
elements.label: The Collective Intelligence Project

elements.summary:
We can deeply support Indigenous communities with everything needed to protect, maintain and strengthen their traditional knowledge.
Their knowledge is vital to all humanity: how to work with medicine, how to protect vital biodiversity and ecologies.
elements.label: Indigenous Medicine Conservation Fund

elements.summary:
Sacred Plant Alliance is a nonprofit association of churches defending the right to religious exercise for sincere, safety-oriented, and ethical ceremony with sacred substances in the United States.
SPA is a membership organization providing education to our members and the public about best practices and self-governance through collaborative ethics, transparency, and accountability.
elements.label: Sacred Plant Alliance

elements.summary:
Reconnect with your essence, to community, and to all that is.
In today’s disconnected world, Roots to Thrive offers a path back to your true self and a supportive community. Our programs help you reconnect with your essence, rediscover a sense of belonging, and tap into the abundant resources around you. From this secure and grounded place, you’ll remember who you truly are and unlock your innate capacity for healing.

Join us at Roots to Thrive and start your journey to wholeness and well-being.
elements.label: Roots to Thrive
PACE Philanthropy for Active Civic Engagement
Wilbur Hot Springs, Northern CA, CA
Noe Valley Farmers Market, San Francisco, CA

elements.summary:
Understanding how elements interconnect, influence each other, and produce emergent behavior; seeing patterns, feedback loops, and leverage points rather than isolated events
Understanding how elements interconnect, influence each other, and produce emergent behavior; seeing patterns, feedback loops, and leverage points rather than isolated events
elements.label: Systems Thinking

elements.summary: Using futures thinking, scenario planning, and early warning systems to act proactively rather than reactively; developing capacity to sense what's emerging
elements.label: Anticipatory Foresight

elements.summary: Combining scientific, Indigenous, experiential, and local knowledge through participatory research and organizational learning; honoring diverse epistemologies as assets
elements.label: Integrative Knowledge Systems

elements.summary: Recognizing limits of any single way of knowing while still making sound judgments; distinguishing between uncertainty (we don't know yet) and unknowability (we can't know)
elements.label: Epistemological Humility & Discernment

elements.summary: Working fluidly across different ontologies and worldviews; building bridges between incompatible-seeming perspectives without forcing false synthesis
elements.label: Cross-Paradigm Navigation

elements.summary: Recognizing how historical and ongoing trauma shapes individuals and communities; creating conditions for healing that restore capacity rather than simply managing symptoms; understanding that unprocessed trauma blocks transformation
elements.label: Trauma-Informed & Healing-Centered Practices

elements.summary: Developing individual and collective capacity to acknowledge, feel, and move through loss; understanding that transformation requires letting go; creating ritual and space for grief as essential rather than optional work
elements.label: Grief Literacy & Transition Navigation

elements.summary: Generating new narratives and cultural forms that make sense of upheaval, provide orientation, and inspire action; reviving or creating rituals that mark transitions and build meaning; understanding culture as active creation, not passive inheritance
elements.label: Story, Myth & Ritual Creation

elements.summary: Building capacity to work constructively with conflict; practices of restorative justice, accountability, and reconciliation that repair harm and rebuild relationship; distinguishing between destructive conflict that fragments and constructive conflict that clarifies and strengthens
elements.label: Conflict Transformation & Relational Repair

elements.summary: Cultivating inner resources—presence, equanimity, compassion, connection to something larger—that sustain individuals and communities through prolonged uncertainty; drawing on diverse spiritual traditions as sources of resilience
elements.label: Spiritual & Contemplative Practice

elements.summary: Designing institutions that can learn, reorganize, and evolve; enabling multiple centers of decision-making to coordinate without centralized control; building flexibility and redundancy rather than optimized rigidity
elements.label: Adaptive & Polycentric Governance

elements.summary: Expanding meaningful participation in decisions; creating processes where diverse voices shape outcomes rather than merely providing input; building legitimacy through inclusion and transparency
elements.label: Participatory & Deliberative Democracy

elements.summary: Making power visible: who holds it, how it operates, whose interests it serves; designing systems that prevent elite capture, ensure transparency, and enable consequences for abuse of authority; setting boundaries on sociopathic incentives and behaviors
elements.label: Power Analysis & Accountability Mechanisms

elements.summary: Ensuring transformations don't reproduce or deepen existing inequalities; centering those most impacted in design and decision-making; addressing historical harms while building new systems
elements.label: Justice-Centered Transition Planning

elements.summary: Aligning and integrating action across local, regional, national, and global levels; preventing fragmentation while respecting appropriate scales of decision-making; managing tensions between subsidiarity and coordination
elements.label: Cross-Scale Coordination

elements.summary: Diversifying, localizing, and ecologizing food production; building regional food security while regenerating soil, water, and biodiversity; shortening supply chains and strengthening farmer-consumer relationships
elements.label: Food System Resilience

elements.summary: Regenerating degraded ecosystems; managing land and watersheds for long-term health rather than short-term extraction; recognizing interdependence of soil, water, biodiversity, and climate stability
elements.label: Land & Water Stewardship

elements.summary: Rapidly expanding renewable energy while dramatically reducing consumption; building distributed generation and storage; ensuring universal energy access without fossil dependence
elements.label: Energy Transition & Efficiency

elements.summary: Designing systems where materials cycle continuously; eliminating waste through reuse, repair, and regeneration; decoupling production from virgin resource extraction
elements.label: Circular Economy & Sustainable Production

elements.summary: Building business models that embed ecological limits and social purpose into their structure; shifting from extraction-for-profit toward stewardship-for-wellbeing; democratizing ownership and decision-making
elements.label: Cooperative & Regenerative Enterprise
